revised_title: The Nature of Cyclonic Depressions and Revolving Fluid in the Atmosphere
tldr: The author examines the nature of cyclonic depressions and concludes that they are not examples of revolving fluid in the specific sense referred to. The motion of air in cyclones is not symmetrical with regard to a center, and the circular appearance of cyclones on weather maps is due to their traveling with a speed similar to the velocity of the wind.
